output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have gained a solid understanding of the core concepts and techniques in privacy-preserving machine learning, enabling you to develop and deploy machine learning models that protect sensitive data.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Privacy-Preserving Machine Learning course! In this course, you will learn about the fundamental concepts and techniques for building machine learning models that protect the privacy of sensitive data. This course is designed for individuals with an intermediate understanding of machine learning and data privacy.

chapters.description: Overview of privacy risks in machine learning, introduction to privacy-preserving techniques, and the trade-off between privacy and utility.
Formal definition of differential privacy, sensitivity, privacy budget (epsilon and delta), and basic composition theorems.
Laplace mechanism, Gaussian mechanism, exponential mechanism, and their applications in machine learning.
Introduction to federated learning, its advantages and challenges, and setting up a federated learning environment.
Detailed explanation of the federated averaging algorithm, client selection, and aggregation techniques.
Combining federated learning with differential privacy and secure aggregation techniques.
Introduction to homomorphic encryption, different types of homomorphic encryption schemes (fully, partially, somewhat), and their properties.
Introduction to SMPC, secret sharing, garbled circuits, and applications in privacy-preserving machine learning.
Real-world applications of privacy-preserving machine learning, future research directions, and open challenges.
